poem:
Title: On the Wings of the Muted

Censor ascends, like the hawk's sharpened talon,
Upon words of Asna, stirring courage born anew.
Through tabloids, truth forced to creep, a challenged sparrow,
From the heart of Palestine, her stories flew.

Innocence measured not by the age of flesh,
But the purity of hearts, in oppression's mesh.
Hold the echoes in your breath,
Humanity stands against death.
